div.l: To bedde goth aleyn ⁊and Also Iohan
Ther nas nomore þem neded no dwale
Þis Myller hath so wisely bibbid ale
That as an hors he snortith in his slepe
Ne of his taile be hynd he toke no kepe
His wif bare hym a burdoıı̄un a ful strongh
Men myghten here routyng heren a forlong
The wenche Routeth Eke ꝑpar companye
Aleyn þe clerke þat herd þis melodye
He plokkid Iohn and seide slepistþow
Herdest þow eủer slike a song as nowe
Lo slike a couplyng is by twix hem Alle
A wild fyre on þaire bodies falle
Ho herkened eủer slike a ferly þyng
Ȝe þei shal haue þᵉ floure of ille endyng
This long nyght þer tides me no rest
But ȝe no force Al shal be for þe beste
For Iohan saide here as eủer mote I thryue
Ȝif þat I may ȝon wenche wil I swyue
Some esement of law shapen vs
For Iohn þer is a law þat seith þus
That if a man be in oon poynt a greuyd
Þat in an oþer he shal be releued
Oure corn is stole sothely it is nonay
And we have hadde an euel fitte to day
And syn I shalhalshal haue haue noon amendement
A gayn my losloelos I wil haue Esement
By goddes saule it shal noon oþ̉er be
Þis Iohan vnsward Aleyn a vise the
The Miller is a ꝑperilous man he seide
And if þat he out of his slepe a braide
He myght doon vs bothe a vyleny
Aleyn vnswarid I counte hym noȝt a flye
And vp he rest and by the wenche crepe
This wenche lay vpriȝt and fast slepte
Til he so nygh was or she myȝt aspye
